symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/AggregationBaseDelegate
symbols.description:
Base delegate implementation for {@link sap.ui.mdc.Control MDC Controls}. This delegate serves as base implementation for aggregation-based controls, such as:
  • sap.ui.mdc.Chart
  • sap.ui.mdc.Table
  • sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar
The AggregationBaseDelegate provides an interface for aggregation based functionality by providing an array of PropertyInfo objects, which can be used during runtime for personalization through the according addItem and removeItem hooks. Additional hooks for cleanup and validation mechanisms can be implemented through this delegate.

methods.name: addItem

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Instance of an sap.ui.mdc.Control. Note: The addItem hook can be used during the processing of an SAPUI5 flexibility change.

parameters.name: sPropertyName
parameters.description: The name of the property info object

parameters.name: mPropertyBag
parameters.description: Instance of property bag from SAPUI5 flexibility change API

methods.description: Central hook to add items to the provided control instance. This method must return a promise that resolves with an instance of the implementing {@link sap.ui.mdc.Control Control} default aggregation. Consequently the parameter mPropertyBag is only passed during preprocessing. In runtime scenarios (such as opening a personalization dialog), this method might be called without the parameter mPropertyBag.

methods.name: fetchProperties

returnValue.description: Once resolved, an array of property info objects is returned

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Instance of an sap.ui.mdc.Control

methods.description:
Retrieves the relevant metadata for a given payload and returns the property info array.
By default, this method returns a Promise that resolves into [].

methods.name: onAfterXMLChangeProcessing

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: XML node of a mdc control

parameters.name: mPropertyBag
parameters.description: Property bag from SAPUI5 flexibility

methods.description: Hook that will be executed when changes are done applying to controls during the XML flexibility change appliance process.

methods.name: removeItem

returnValue.description: Promise resolving in a boolean, deciding whether the item should be destroyed (true) or kept (false) after removing it from the control aggregation.

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Instance of a sap.ui.mdc.Control

parameters.name: oItem
parameters.description: The control instance that was removed

parameters.name: mPropertyBag
parameters.description: Instance of property bag from SAPUI5 flexibility

methods.description:
Triggers any necessary follow-up steps that need to be taken after the removal of created items via removeItem. The returned Boolean value inside the Promise can be used to prevent the default follow-up behavior of the SAPUI5 flexibility handling.
By default, this method returns a Promise that resolves into true. This will ensure, that the item will be destroyed subsequentially after it has been removed by the control. Note: The removeItem hook can be used during the processing of an SAPUI5 flexibility change. Consequently the parameter mPropertyBag is only passed during preprocessing. In runtime scenarios (such as opening a personalization dialog), this method might be called without the parameter mPropertyBag.

symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/BaseDelegate
symbols.description:
Basic Delegate for {@link sap.ui.mdc.Control}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.Element}
All delegate implementations for MDC controls must be derived directly or indirectly from this entity. Applications should implement {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/BaseDelegate.getTypeMap getTypeMap} to provide type mappings based on their model usage. Please also see the following extensible presets: {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/DefaultTypeMap sap.ui.mdc.DefaultTypeMap}, {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/odata/TypeMap sap.ui.mdc.odata.TypeMap}, {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/odata/v4/TypeMap sap.ui.mdc.odata.v4.TypeMap}

methods.name: getTypeMap

returnValue.description: typeMap configuration for this delegate Note: The returned array will also serve as a key in the weakmap-based typeutil cache of BaseDelegate

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Delegate payload object

methods.description: Returns the typeutil configuration for this delegate.

symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/ChartDelegate
symbols.description:
Base Delegate for {@link sap.ui.mdc.Chart Chart}. Extend this object in your project to use all functionalities of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Chart Chart}.
This class provides method calls, that are called by the Chart for specific operations and overwrite the internal behavior.

Creates a new chart item for a given property name and updates the inner chart.
Note: This does not add the chart item to the Items aggregation of the chart. Called and used by p13n.

methods.description: The provided map is used to determine the navigation behavior of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.chart.ChartSelectionDetails}. The navigation shows a list of all entries if more than 1 entry of {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInfoBase} is given in the map. If there is only one entry, the navigation goes directly to the content of the given {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldInfoBase}.

returnValue.description: Array of the property infos that is used within the chart

parameters.name: oChart
parameters.description: Reference to the chart

methods.description: Gets the relevant PropertyInfo objects based on the metadata used with the chart instance. Note: The result of this function must be kept stable throughout the lifecycle of your application. Any changes of the returned values might result in undesired effects. Note: Existing properties (set via sap.ui.mdc.Chart#setPropertyInfo) must not be removed and their attributes must not be changed during the {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/ChartDelegate.fetchProperties fetchProperties} callback. Otherwise validation errors might occur whenever personalization-related control features (such as the opening of any personalization dialog) are activated.

symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/DefaultTypeMap
symbols.description:
Generic {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/util/TypeMap TypeMap} configuration for simple use cases. Note: The modules of all data types registered in a TypeMap must be loaded in advance.
Note: This {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/util/TypeMap TypeMap} implementation contains the following types:
  • {@link sap.ui.model.type.Boolean} (alias Boolean)
  • {@link sap.ui.model.type.Currency} (alias Currency)
  • {@link sap.ui.model.type.Date} (alias Date)
  • {@link sap.ui.model.type.DateTime} (alias DateTime)
  • {@link sap.ui.model.type.Float} (alias Float)
  • {@link sap.ui.model.type.Integer} (alias Integer)
  • {@link sap.ui.model.type.String} (alias String)
  • {@link sap.ui.model.type.Time} (alias Time)
  • {@link sap.ui.model.type.Unit} (alias Unit)

symbols.description: Delegate for {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase FieldBase}.

methods.name: createCondition

returnValue.description: Returns a condition object that is set on the control

parameters.name: oField
parameters.description: Field control instance

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Instance of the calling control

parameters.name: aValues
parameters.description: Key and description for the condition that is created

parameters.name: oCurrentCondition
parameters.description: Currently available condition before the property change

methods.description:
Enables applications to control condition updates based on value / additionalvalue property changes.
By default, this method returns a condition with an EQ operator. Note: Custom implementations of this method may lead to intransparency as a field's condition may then differ from the state of the value / additionalvalue properties. Avoid expensive operations, as this can delay the rendering of the output.

methods.name: createConditionPayload

returnValue.description: Optionally returns a serializeable object to be stored in the condition payload field.

parameters.name: oField
parameters.description: Field control instance

parameters.name: oControl
parameters.description: Instance of the calling control

parameters.name: aValues
parameters.description: key, description pair for the condition which is to be created.

methods.description: Provides the possibility to convey custom data in conditions. This enables an application to enhance conditions with data relevant for combined key or out parameter scenarios.

methods.name: createContent

returnValue.description: Array containing the created controls and the default value help, if needed

parameters.name: oField
parameters.description: Field control instance

parameters.name: sContentMode
parameters.description: A given content mode

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID of the internal control to be created.

parameters.name: bProvideDefaultValueHelp
parameters.description: If set, a default value help should be provided.

methods.description:
Provides the possibility to customize / replace the internal content of a field
By default, this method returns suitable controls for the given {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.BaseType BaseType}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase#setMaxConditions maxConditions} and {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.ContentMode ContentMode}. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: The returned controls must implement {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent}. Other controls might lead to layouting or usabillity issues.

methods.name: getAutocompleteOutput

returnValue.description: Output text or boolean true, if the autocomplete value should be accepted without modifying the visible input

parameters.name: oField
parameters.description: Field control instance

parameters.name: oCondition
parameters.description: Condition

parameters.name: sKey
parameters.description: Formatted text of the key (value)

parameters.name: sDescription
parameters.description: FormattedText of the description

parameters.name: bKeyMatch
parameters.description: If true the key matches to the user input

parameters.name: bDescriptionMatch
parameters.description: If true the description matches to the user input

methods.description: Determines the text for the autocomplete functionality. This function is called during a user's type-ahead into a {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField}, or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} control. The returned text will be shown as selected after the user input ends. By default this method uses the {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase#getDisplay display} property of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField}, or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} control to determine what text (key or description) is used as autocomplete-text. A text is only used if it matches the user input. If set to Value, the key is used. If set to Description, the description is used. If set to ValueDescription, the key is used, if it maps, otherwise the description. If set to DescriptionValue, the description is used, if it maps, otherwise the key. Note: Whatever this function returns, the user input will not be overwritten, only the text after the user input will be added and shown as selected. Otherwise the cursor position might change or the user input changes while typing what would lead to confusion.

throws.description: if the description cannot be determined

methods.description:
Determines the description for a given key.
By default, this method calls the {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp#getItemForValue getItemForValue} function of the assigned {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp ValueHelp}. This function is called while formatting the output of a {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField}, or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} control if a description should be displayed but only a key is given. If this needs to be determined asynchronously, a Promise is returned. As the key might change (uppercase), an object with key and description can be returned. If the description cannot be determined, a corresponding {@link sap.ui.model.FormatException FormatException} is thrown.

methods.name: getItemForValue

methods.description:
Determines the key, description, and payload of a user input.
By default, this method calls the {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp#getItemForValue getItemForValue} function of the assigned {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp ValueHelp}. If this needs to be determined asynchronously, a Promise is returned. If the item cannot be determined, a corresponding {@link sap.ui.model.ParseException ParseException} is thrown.

methods.name: getInResultPropertyKeys

returnValue.description: Property keys

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

methods.description:
Returns the keys of properties that should always be included in the result of the collection requested from the back end. This information is applied when updating the table's binding. By default, this method returns an empty array. Note: If properties are provided in the table's {@link sap.ui.mdc.Table propertyInfo} property, the properties whose keys are returned by this method must be included, otherwise they may not be in included the result.
The path of a property must not be empty.
If a property is complex, the properties it references are taken into account.
If autoExpandSelect of the {@link sap.ui.model.odata.v4.ODataModel} is not enabled, this method must return an empty array. See also the restrictions in the description of the {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/odata/v4/TableDelegate TableDelegate} if data aggregation is enabled.
For more information about properties, see {@link sap.ui.mdc.odata.v4.TableDelegate.PropertyInfo PropertyInfo}.

parameters.description: The binding info object to be used to bind the table

parameters.name: mSettings

forceRefresh.name: forceRefresh
forceRefresh.description: Indicates that the binding has to be refreshed even if the binding info has not changed

parameters.description: Additional settings

methods.description: Updates the binding of the table with the binding info object returned from {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.updateBindingInfo updateBindingInfo}. If an update is not possible, it rebinds the table. Compares the current and previous state of the table to detect whether rebinding is necessary. The diffing is done for the sorters, filters, aggregation, parameters, and the path of the binding. Other {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject.AggregationBindingInfo binding info} keys, such as events or model, must be provided in updateBindingInfo, and those keys must not be changed conditionally. Note: To remove a binding info parameter, the value must be set to undefined in updateBindingInfo. For more information, see {@link sap.ui.model.odata.v4.ODataListBinding#changeParameters}.

symbols.name: module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate
symbols.description:
Base delegate for {@link sap.ui.mdc.Table}. Extend this object in your project to use all functionalities of the table. This base delegate already meets some requirements of certain features. Others need to be met by your delegate implementation. The following methods need to be added or overridden in your delegate. Please also see the documentation of the methods to learn about their default implementation and what you need to implement.
  • Basic prerequisites
    • {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.fetchProperties fetchProperties}
    • {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.updateBindingInfo updateBindingInfo}
  • Column personalization (related to p13nMode Column)
    • {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.addItem addItem}
    • Filter personalization (related to p13nMode Filter)
      • {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.getFilterDelegate getFilterDelegate}
    Note: This base delegate does not support the p13nMode Aggregate, and the p13nMode Group is only supported if the table type is {@link sap.ui.mdc.table.ResponsiveTableType ResponsiveTable}. This cannot be changed in your delegate implementation.

methods.name: addItem

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves with a column

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table or an XML node representing the table during preprocessing

parameters.name: sPropertyKey
parameters.description: The property key

parameters.name: mPropertyBag
parameters.description: Instance of a property bag from the SAPUI5 flexibility API

methods.description: Central hook that is called to add columns to the table when the state is applied, for example, when SAPUI5 flexibility changes are applied. During preprocessing, this method is called without the mPropertyBag parameter, and oTable is an XML node. By default, this method does not create a column and just returns a Promise that resolves without a value.

methods.name: fetchExpandAndCollapseConfiguration

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves with an object containing the expand and collapse functions

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Table instance

methods.description:
Returns the feature set for expanding or collapsing nodes in the table. By default, this method returns an empty object. To enable specific functionalities, the configuration must contain the following functions:
  • To enable Expand Entire Tree, the expandAll function needs to be implemented.
  • To enable Collapse Entire Tree, the collapseAll function needs to be implemented.
  • To enable Expand Entire Node, the expandAllFromNode and isNodeExpanded functions need to be implemented.
  • To enable Collapse Entire Node, the collapseAllFromNode and isNodeExpanded functions need to be implemented.
Note: Expand and collapse all from a specific node is only supported if the table rows are selectable.

methods.name: fetchExportCapabilities

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves with an object as specified in {@link sap.ui.export.ExportHandler}

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

methods.description: Returns the feature set for exporting data in the table. By default, this method returns basic sap.ui.export.FileType.XLSX capabilities.

methods.name: fetchProperties

returnValue.description: A Promise that resolves with the property information

parameters.name: oTable
parameters.description: Instance of the table

methods.description:
Retrieves information about the relevant properties. By default, this method returns a Promise that resolves with an empty array. Note:
  • The result of this function must be kept stable throughout the lifecycle of your application. Any changes of the returned values might result in undesired effects.
  • Existing properties (set via sap.ui.mdc.Table#setPropertyInfo) must not be removed and their attributes must not be changed during the {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/TableDelegate.fetchProperties fetchProperties} callback. Otherwise validation errors might occur whenever personalization-related control features (such as the opening of any personalization dialog) are activated.

methods.description: Returns the content that is used for the autocomplete feature and for user input, if the entered text leads to more than one filter result. By default, this method searches and returns an entry from a set of relevant contexts of the given {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.ListContent ListContent}. To determine which columns are relevant for the search, the currently active displayMode {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldDisplay Display} of the connected control will be used. While a Value configuration will lead to a 'key'-only search, DescriptionValue leads to searching the description first and the key afterwards. Other modes work the same way. For each relevant column all items are searched for an exact match first and again with a startsWith filter afterwards, if necessary. If the caseSensitive property is disabled, whichever entry comes first, wins, whether the user's input is in lowercase or uppercase letters. {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.base.ListContent ListContent}

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc
symbols.description: OpenUI5 library that contains metadata-driven composite controls, which can be extended for use with any SAPUI5 model and data protocol.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.actiontoolbar.ActionToolbarAction
symbols.description: The action for an {@link sap.ui.mdc.ActionToolbar ActionToolbar} control with given layout information that determines where the wrapped control is displayed on the ActionToolbar.

properties.description: Contains the information where the action is displayed on the ActionToolbar. The layoutInformation has to be of type {@link sap.ui.mdc.actiontoolbar.ActionToolbarActionLayoutInformation}.

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.description:
The Chart control creates a chart based on metadata and the configuration specified.
Note: The Chart control acts as a wrapper that is used to enhance an instance of a given chart control framework (in the following texts referred to as inner chart) with functionalities, such as a toolbar, p13n, and VariantManagement. The inner chart instance and its configuration must be provided via an implementation of a ChartDelegate module.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the chart.

properties.name: height
properties.description: Defines the height of the chart.

properties.name: delegate
header
properties.description: Specifies header text that is shown in the chart.

properties.name: noDataText
properties.description: Defines the no data text shown in the chart.

properties.name: p13nMode
properties.description:
Specifies the personalization options available for the chart.
Note: The order of the provided options does not influence the arrangement of the icons on the UI.

properties.name: legendVisible
properties.description:
Enables the legend of the chart.
Note: The setter calls setLegendVisible of the delegate class.

properties.name: ignoreToolbarActions
properties.description: Specifies which actions must not be available in the chart's toolbar.

properties.name: minWidth
properties.description: Defines the minimum width of the chart.

properties.name: minHeight
properties.description: Defines the minimum height of the chart.

properties.name: sortConditions
properties.description:
Defines the sort conditions.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is exclusively used for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it for anything else.

properties.name: filterConditions
properties.description:
Defines the filter conditions.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is exclusively used for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it for anything else.

properties.name: showChartTooltip
properties.description:
Controls the visibility of the chart tooltip.
Note: If set to true, a call of the delegate.setChartTooltipVisibility is triggered and can be used to make the Chart tooltip visible.

properties.name: autoBindOnInit
properties.description:
If set to true, the chart is automatically bound after initialization.
If set to false, the chart is bound after the first call to rebind.

properties.name: chartType
properties.description: Specifies the type of chart to be created by the Chart control.

properties.name: showSelectionDetails
properties.description: Enables the Details button in the chart toolbar.

properties.name: propertyInfo
properties.description:
Specifies the chart metadata.
Note: This property must not be bound.
Note: This property is exclusively used for handling SAPUI5 flexibility changes. Do not use it otherwise.
Note: Existing properties (set via sap.ui.mdc.Chart#setPropertyInfo) must not be removed and their attributes must not be changed during the {@link module:sap/ui/mdc/ChartDelegate.fetchProperties fetchProperties} callback. Otherwise validation errors might occur whenever personalization-related control features (such as the opening of any personalization dialog) are activated. Note: For more information about the supported inner elements, see {@link sap.ui.mdc.chart.PropertyInfo PropertyInfo}.

properties.name: headerLevel
properties.description:
Semantic level of the header.
For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setLevel}.

properties.name: headerStyle
properties.description: Defines style of the header. For more information, see {@link sap.m.Title#setTitleStyle}.

properties.name: headerVisible
properties.description: Determines whether the header text is shown in the chart. Regardless of its value, the given header text is used to label the chart correctly for accessibility purposes.

aggregations.name: items
aggregations.description: This property describes the measures and dimensions visible in the chart. Changes in the personalization are also reflected here. Note: This aggregation is managed by the control, can only be populated during the definition in the XML view, and is not bindable. Any changes of the initial aggregation content might result in undesired effects. Changes of the aggregation have to be made with the {@link sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil StateUtil}.

aggregations.name: actions
aggregations.description:
This aggregation describes actions that are added to the chart toolbar.
For more information, see {@link sap.ui.mdc.actiontoolbar.ActionToolbarAction}. Note: This aggregation is managed by the control, can only be populated during the definition in the XML view, and is not bindable. Any changes of the initial aggregation content might result in undesired effects. Changes of the aggregation have to be made with the {@link sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil StateUtil}.

aggregations.name: selectionDetailsActions
aggregations.description:
Feeds details popover actions for data point selection in the chart.
For more information, see {@link sap.ui.mdc.chart.SelectionDetailsActions SelectionDetailsActions}.

aggregations.name: variant
aggregations.description: Reference to a {@link sap.ui.fl.variants.VariantManagement} control for the chart.

aggregations.name: noData
aggregations.description:
Defines the custom visualization if there is no data available.
This control will be displayed on top of the chart when no data is visible inside the chart.
Note: If both a noDataText property and a noData aggregation are provided, the noData aggregation takes priority.
If the noData aggregation is undefined or set to null, the noDataText property is used instead.

associations.name: filter
associations.description: Control or object that enables the chart to do filtering, such as {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar}. See also {@link sap.ui.mdc.IFilter}. Automatic filter generation only works in combination with a sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar.

events.name: selectionDetailsActionPressed
events.description: This event is fired when a SelectionDetailsAction is pressed.

action.name: action
action.description: The action that has to be processed once the action has been pressed

itemContexts.name: itemContexts
itemContexts.description: If the action is pressed on one of the {@link sap.m.SelectionDetailsItem items}, the parameter contains the {@link sap.ui.model.Context context} of the pressed {@link sap.m.SelectionDetailsItem item}. If a custom action or action group of the SelectionDetails popover is pressed, this parameter contains all {@link sap.ui.model.Context contexts} of the {@link sap.m.SelectionDetailsItem items}.

level.name: level
level.description: The action level of action buttons. The available levels are Item, List and Group

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.name: getActions
methods.description:
Gets content of aggregation {@link #getActions actions}. This aggregation describes actions that are added to the chart toolbar.
For more information, see {@link sap.ui.mdc.actiontoolbar.ActionToolbarAction}. Note: This aggregation is managed by the control, can only be populated during the definition in the XML view, and is not bindable. Any changes of the initial aggregation content might result in undesired effects. Changes of the aggregation have to be made with the {@link sap.ui.mdc.p13n.StateUtil StateUtil}.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.chart.ChartImplementationContainer
symbols.description: The ChartImplementationContainer creates a container for the content (chart) and noDataContent. Based on the showNoDataStruct the content or noDataContent will be shown.

properties.name: showNoDataStruct
properties.description: Toggles the visibility of the noDataContent & content

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Content/Chart to be visualized.

aggregations.name: noDataContent
aggregations.description:
Control that is shown when there is no data available inside the chart.
This can be used if the standard behavior of the used chart control needs to be overriden.
To show this noDataContent, set {@link #getShowNoDataStruct showNoDataStruct}.

associations.name: chartNoDataContent
associations.description:
Association to noData content set in the chart.
If set, this will be used instead of the noDataContent aggregation.

parameters.name: sId
parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no id is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new ChartImplementationContainer. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

methods.description: Destroys the noDataContent in the aggregation {@link #getNoDataContent noDataContent}.

properties.name: enableNavCallback
properties.description:
Callback function that is called for each SelectionDetailsItem to determine if the navigation is enabled. The callback is called with the following parameters:
  • oSelectionDetails {@link sap.ui.mdc.chart.ChartSelectionDetails}: Instance of this ChartSelectionDetails
  • oContext {@link sap.ui.model.Context}: Binding context of the SelectionDetailsItem
The return value of the callback has to be of type boolean.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.chart.PropertyInfo

An object literal describing a data property in the context of a {@link sap.ui.mdc.Chart}. When specifying the PropertyInfo objects in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Chart#getPropertyInfo propertyInfo} property, the following attributes need to be specified:
  • key
  • label
  • groupable
  • aggregatable
  • role
  • dataType

properties.name: groupable
properties.description: Defines whether the property is groupable and is selectable as a dimension in the chart

properties.name: aggregatable
properties.description: Defines whether the property is aggregatable and is selectable as a measure in the chart

properties.name: role
properties.description: Defines the role that the property visualizes inside the chart

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject
symbols.description: Condition object type defining the structure of a condition.

properties.name: operator
properties.description: Operator of the condition. The standard operators can are mentioned in {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.OperatorName OperatorName}.

properties.name: values
properties.description: Array of values of the condition. Depending on the operator, this contains one or more entries. The entries are stored in an internal format regarding the used data type.

properties.name: inParameters
properties.description: In parameters of the condition. For each field path, a value is stored. (It is obsolete and only filled for conditions stored on old user-variants.)

properties.name: outParameters
properties.description: Out parameters of the condition. For each field path, a value is stored. (It is obsolete and only filled for conditions stored on old user-variants.)

properties.name: isEmpty
properties.description: If set, the condition is empty (used as initially empty condition in {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.Conditions Conditions})

properties.name: validated
properties.description: If set to ConditionValidated.Validated, the condition is validated (by the value help) and not shown in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.Conditions Conditions} content

properties.name: payload
properties.description: Payload of the condition. Set by application. Data needs to be stringified. (as stored and loaded in variants)

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.condition.Operator
symbols.description: Creates an sap.ui.mdc.condition.Operator object. This is used in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control to define which filter operators are supported. If a function or property is initial, the default implementation is used.

parameters.name: oConfiguration

name.name: name
name.description: Name of the operator used in the condition

alias.name: alias
alias.description:
Alias names based on {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.BaseType BaseType}, used to map to {@link sap.m.DynamicDateOption DynamicDateOption} if {@link sap.m.DynamicDateRange DynamicDateRange} is used to visualize the filter
For example, if an operator must use the DATE option if used for a date type and the DATETIME option if used for a date/time type, the alias needs to be configured as {Date: "DATE", DateTime: "DATETIME"}.

filterOperator.name: filterOperator
filterOperator.description: The operator's default filter operator that is created as defined in {@link sap.ui.model.FilterOperator FilterOperator}

tokenParse.name: tokenParse
tokenParse.description: The string representation of the regular expression that is used by the operator to parse a value to eliminate the operator and get the data string. A placeholder that refers to the translated tokenText can be used. #tokenText# refers to the oConfiguration.tokenText property if given.

tokenTest.name: tokenTest
tokenTest.description:
The string representation of the regular expression that is used to test if the given text meets the operator. A placeholder that refers to the translated tokenText can be used. #tokenText# refers to the oConfiguration.tokenText property if given.
If not provided, the tokenParse regular expression is used.

tokenFormat.name: tokenFormat
tokenFormat.description: The string representation that is used by the operator to format a value into an output string. For the value placeholder {0} and {1} are used. A placeholder that refers to the translated tokenText can be used. #tokenText# refers to the oConfiguration.tokenText property if given.

valueTypes.name: valueTypes
valueTypes.description:
Array of type to be used. The length of the array defines the number of values that need to be entered with the operator.
If set to {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.OperatorValueType.Self OperatorValueType.Self}, the Type of the Field or FilterField using the Operator is used.
If set to {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.OperatorValueType.SelfNoParse OperatorValueType.SelfNoParse} same as {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.OperatorValueType.Self OperatorValueType.Self}, except that the input value parsing will not be called.
If set to {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.OperatorValueType.Static OperatorValueType.Static}, a simple string type is used to display static text.
If set to a name of a data type, an instance of this data type is used.
If set to an object with structure {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ValueType}, an instance of the corresponding data type is used. The type given via name must be loaded by the application.
If set to null, the corresponding value is interpreted as a description that holds no required data. To display this value, the additional Type of the Field or FilterField using the Operator is used.

longText.name: longText
longText.description:
String representation of the operator as a long text.
This text is shown in the operator dropdown of the value help.
If longText is not given , the tokenText is used, replacing the placeholders "{0}" and "{1}" with "X" and "Y".

tokenText.name: tokenText
tokenText.description:
String representation of the operator as a short text.
This text is only needed if there any language dependent text should be shown on the token, like "Next 5 days". (In this case #tokenText# is used in tokenFormat, tokenTest, or tokenParse.) For operators just showing the value and a operator symbol, no token text is needed.
If the token text is not given, the longText is used. If tokenTextForTypes is provided for a special type, it will be used for that.

tokenTextForTypes.name: tokenTextForTypes
tokenTextForTypes.description:
Object holding string representation of the operator as a token text for single basic types.
This text is shown as text in a single-value field or as token in a multi-value field.
This is needed if the text depends on the data type used. For example, the "equal" operator should be named "Not Specified (empty)" if a date or time type is used.

longTextForTypes.name: longTextForTypes
longTextForTypes.description:
Object holding String representation of the operator as a long text for single basic types.
This text is shown in the operator dropdown of the value help.
This is needed if the text depends on the used data type. For example the "less than" operator should be named "before" if a date or time type is used.

displayFormats.name: displayFormats
displayFormats.description: Pattern how different {@link sap.ui.mdc.enums.FieldDisplay displayFormats} are rendered

parse.name: parse
parse.description: Function to parse input into condition

getModelFilter.name: getModelFilter
getModelFilter.description: Function create filter for a condition

isEmpty.name: isEmpty
isEmpty.description: Function to check if condition is empty

createControl.name: createControl
createControl.description: Function to create a control to be used in {@link sap.ui.mdc.valuehelp.content.Conditions Conditions}

getCheckValue.name: getCheckValue
getCheckValue.description: Function to get the value for condition compare

getValues.name: getValues
getValues.description: Function to get the real values without operator symbol

checkValidated.name: checkValidated
checkValidated.description: Function to check if a condition is validated (sets the validated property)

exclude.name: exclude
exclude.description: If set, the operator is handled as exclude filter when creating the filters of all conditions

validateInput.name: validateInput
validateInput.description: If set, the user input for this operator needs to be validated using a value help

additionalInfo.name: additionalInfo
additionalInfo.description: additionalInfo text for the operator. Will be shown in the operator suggest as second column. If not used (undefined) the Include or Exclude information of the operator is used.

group.name: group

id.name: id
id.description:
Group ID for the operator. The following groups are available for the {@link sap.m.DynamicDateRange DynamicDateRange} control:
  • 1 - Single Dates
  • 2 - Date Ranges
  • 3 - Weeks
  • 4 - Months
  • 5 - Quarters
  • 6 - Years
See {@link sap.m.DynamicDateRangeGroups DynamicDateRangeGroups}.
This only works for FilterFields with custom operators if maxConditions=1 and no valueHelp is assigned to the FilterField. Example:
group: undefined - if group is not specified; default behavior include/exclude group with id 1 and 2 will be created
group: {id : 1} - adds the operator to existing group 1 'Single Dates'
group: {id : 2, text: "new group"} - inserts a new group with id 2. Existing group 2 will be shifted to 3, 4....
group: {id : 10, text: "new group at the end"} - adds a new group with id 10 and text "new group as the end" to the end of all groups
Note: The ids 900-999 are reserved for internal mdc usage, please use only IDs outside of this range.

text.name: text
text.description: Group title for the operator. When used a new group with this title will be added.

group.description: Additional group settings for the operator. Will be used by the DynamicDateRange. If not used (undefined), the operators will be added to the include and exclude groups.

groupsForTypes.name: groupsForTypes
groupsForTypes.description: Additional group settings for the operator depending on the type. For every type, a group object can be defined.

getTextForCopy.description: Function to determine the text copied into clipboard

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.condition.RangeOperator
symbols.description: Creates a sap.ui.mdc.condition.RangeOperator object. This is used in the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control to define which filter operators are supported. Note: Use this class only for filter field of type date or time related data types. If a function or property is initial, the default implementation is used.

parameters.name: oConfiguration

label.name: label
label.description: Additional array of labels for the values of the operator. Will be shown as placeholder text or label of the value fields.

calcRange.name: calcRange
calcRange.description: Function to calculate the date range of the operation. The function returns an array of UniversalDates. In case of a single filterOperator the array can return a single value.

formatRange.name: formatRange
formatRange.description: Function to format the date range.

defaultValues.name: defaultValues
defaultValues.description: Array of values for the defaults of RangeOperators parameter. This can be a function, which returns the array of values. If not used the default for the values is 1.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum
symbols.description: Enumerations for MDC library

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ActionToolbarActionAlignment
symbols.description: Defines the alignment of the ActionToolbarAction action control.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.BaseType
symbols.description:
Enumeration of the possible basic data types

In {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField}, and {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField}, different data types can be used. These data types might be model-dependent. To handle them model-independently, basic types are used internally.

properties.name: Boolean
properties.description: Data type represents a Boolean

properties.name: Date
properties.description: Data type represents a date

properties.name: DateTime
properties.description: Data type represents a date with time

properties.name: Numeric
properties.description: Data type represents a number. (This can be integer, float or any other numeric type.)

properties.name: String
properties.description: Data type represents a string

properties.name: Time
properties.description: Data type represents a time

properties.name: Unit
properties.description: Data type represents a unit. A composite type with a number and a unit part is used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ConditionValidated
symbols.description: Enumeration of the validated state of conditions If a Condition is chosen from a field help or validated against a field help it is set to be validated. In this case the corresponding item in the value help is shown as selected. If the validated state of the Condition is undefined this means it is not defined if it is validated or not.

properties.name: NotValidated
properties.description: Condition is not validated

properties.name: Validated
properties.description: Condition is validated

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ContentMode
symbols.description: Defines in which mode the content of a {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} is rendered.

properties.name: Display
properties.description: Display mode for single value

properties.name: DisplayMultiLine
properties.description: Display mode for multiline single value

properties.name: DisplayMultiValue
properties.description: Display mode for multiple values

properties.name: Edit
properties.description: Edit mode for single value

properties.name: EditForHelp
properties.description: Edit mode for single value field if a field help is assigned To support field help, in some cases a different control needs to be rendered.

properties.name: EditMultiLine
properties.description: Edit mode for multiple lines single value

properties.name: EditMultiValue
properties.description: Edit mode for multiple values

properties.name: EditOperator
properties.description: Edit mode for operator dependent controls This is used for single value and only one operator.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.EditMode
symbols.description: Defines in what mode a {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} is rendered.

properties.name: Disabled
properties.description: {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} is rendered in disabled mode

properties.name: Display
properties.description: {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} is rendered in display mode

properties.name: Editable
properties.description: {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} is rendered in editable mode

properties.name: EditableDisplay
properties.description: If more than one control is rendered by the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} control, the first part is editable, and the other parts are in display mode.

properties.name: EditableReadOnly
properties.description: If more than one control is rendered by the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} control, the first part is editable, and the other parts are read-only.

properties.name: ReadOnly
properties.description: {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} is rendered in read-only mode

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FieldDisplay
symbols.description: Defines the output of a {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField}, or {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} control. For the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field} control, this enumeration defines how the value and additionalValue properties are formatted. For the {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField} control, this enumeration defines how the key and description properties of the items are formatted. For the {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control, this enumeration defines how key and description of equal conditions are formatted.

properties.name: Description
properties.description: Only the description is displayed

properties.name: DescriptionValue
properties.description: The description and the value (key) are displayed in the field. The value (key) is displayed after the description in brackets.

properties.name: Value
properties.description: Only the value (key) is displayed

properties.name: ValueDescription
properties.description: The value (key) and the description are displayed in the field. The description is displayed after the value (key) in brackets.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.FilterBarValidationStatus
symbols.description: Enumeration of the possible validation types.

properties.name: AsyncValidation
properties.description: Ongoing asynchronous validation.

properties.name: FieldInErrorState
properties.description: Filter field in error state.

properties.name: NoError
properties.description: No errors detected.

properties.name: OngoingChangeAppliance
properties.description: Change is being applied.

properties.name: RequiredHasNoValue
properties.description: Required filter filed without a value.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.LinkType
symbols.description: Defines the behavior of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Link}.

properties.name: DirectLink
properties.description: {@link sap.ui.mdc.Link} is rendered as a {@link sap.m.Link} that works as a direct link

properties.name: Popover
properties.description: {@link sap.ui.mdc.Link} is rendered as a {@link sap.m.Link} that opens a popover when pressed

properties.name: Text
properties.description: {@link sap.ui.mdc.Link} is rendered as a {@link sap.m.Text}

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.OperatorOverwrite
symbols.description: Enumeration of the OperatorOverwrite in Operator.

properties.name: getLongText
properties.description: Overwrite the getTypeText function of the operator.

properties.name: getModelFilter
properties.description: Overwrite the getModelFilter function of the operator.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.OperatorValueType
symbols.description: Defines what data type is used for parse or format the condition values on a {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.Operator Operator}.

properties.name: Self
properties.description: The Type of the Field or FilterField using the Operator is used.

properties.name: SelfNoParse
properties.description: The Type of the Field or FilterField using the Operator is used for validation, but the user input is used as value.

properties.name: Static
properties.description: A simple string type is used to display static text.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ProcessingStrategy
symbols.description: Defines the delta types of the sap.ui.mdc.p13n.Engine.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.PropagationReason
symbols.description: Enumeration of the propagation reason in the condition propagation callback of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.ValueHelp ValueHelp}

properties.name: ControlChange
properties.description: Triggered by connected control after processing valuehelp output

properties.name: Info
properties.description: Triggered by ValueHelp itself on getItemForValue

properties.name: Select
properties.description: Triggered by ValueHelp itself on selection

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.ReasonMode
symbols.description: Enumeration of the possible reasons for the search event.

properties.name: Enter
properties.description: Enter pressed in filter field.

properties.name: Go
properties.description: Go button pressed.

properties.name: Unclear
properties.description: Used if the mentioned reasons are not applicable.

properties.name: Variant
properties.description: The applied variant is marked as Apply Automatically.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.enum.SelectType
symbols.description: Enumeration of the possible selection types

properties.name: Add
properties.description: The given conditions are just added to the existing ones, if they don't already exist.

properties.name: Remove
properties.description: The given conditions are removed.

properties.name: Set
properties.description: The given conditions are set and replace the existing ones.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.Field
symbols.description:
The Field control is used to bind its value to data of a certain data type. Based on the data type settings, a default control is rendered by the Field as follows:
  • In display mode, usually a {@link sap.m.Text Text} control is rendered.
  • If multipleLines is set, an {@link sap.m.ExpandableText ExpandableText} control is rendered.
  • If fieldInfo is set and it is configured to be triggerable, a {@link sap.m.Link Link} control is rendered. The multipleLines property is forwarded to the wrapping property of the {@link sap.m.Link Link} control.
  • In edit mode, usually an {@link sap.m.Input Input} control is rendered.
  • If multipleLines is set, a {@link sap.m.TextArea TextArea} control is rendered.
  • If a date type is used, a {@link sap.m.DatePicker DatePicker} control is rendered.
  • If a date/time type is used, a {@link sap.m.DateTimePicker DateTimePicker} control is rendered.
  • If a time type is used, a {@link sap.m.TimePicker TimePicker} control is rendered.
  • If a currency or unit type is used, two {@link sap.m.Input Input} controls are rendered, one for number and one for unit.

properties.name: value
properties.description: The value of the field. To display the key and the description in one field, the key must be set on the value property.

properties.name: additionalValue
properties.description: The additional value of the field. To display the key and the description in one field, the description must be set on the additionalValue property.

events.name: change
events.description: This event is fired when the value property of the field is changed by user interaction. Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a change event.

value.name: value
value.description: The new value of the Field. If a ValueHelp is assigned to the Field, the value is used as key for the ValueHelp items.

valid.name: valid
valid.description: Flag that indicates if the entered value is valid. This flag is only set if the user input is parsed and validated synchronously. If there is some asynchronous parsing or validation, for example, via request to a back-end system, the validation result will be returned in the promise parameter.

promise.name: promise
promise.description: Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the change event is synchronous, the Promise has already been already resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated. If the user input is not valid, the Promise will be rejected with the corresponding exception. The Field should be set to busy during the parsing to prevent user input. As there might be a whole group of fields that needs to be busy, this cannot be done automatically.

parameters.description: ID for the new control, generated automatically if no ID is given

parameters.name: mSettings
parameters.description: Initial settings for the new control

constructor.description: Constructor for a new Field. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType
symbols.description: This class represents a type that is used to map an array of conditions to a single-value control (such as {@link sap.m.Input Input} or {@link sap.m.Text Text} control).

parameters.name: oFormatOptions

valueType.name: valueType
valueType.description: Type of the value of the condition (used for formatting, parsing and validating)

additionalValueType.name: additionalValueType
additionalValueType.description: Type of the additionalValue (description) of the condition (used for formatting, parsing, and validating)

operators.name: operators
operators.description: Possible operators to be used in the condition

display.name: display
display.description: DisplayFormat used to visualize a value

valueHelpID.name: valueHelpID
valueHelpID.description: ID of the value help to determine the key and description

hideOperator.name: hideOperator
hideOperator.description: If set, only the value of the condition is shown, but no operator. (Use it only if just one operator is supported.)

bindingContext.name: bindingContext
bindingContext.description: BindingContext of field. Used to get a key or description from the value help using in/out parameters. (In a table, the value help might be connected to a different row)

originalDateType.name: originalDateType
originalDateType.description: Type used on field, for example, for date types; a different type is used internally to have different formatOptions

additionalType.name: additionalType
additionalType.description: Additional type used for another part of a field (for example, for unit fields)

compositeTypes.name: compositeTypes
compositeTypes.description: Additional types used for each part of a CompositeType (if valueType is a CompositeType)

additionalCompositeTypes.name: additionalCompositeTypes
additionalCompositeTypes.description: Additional types used for each part of a CompositeType (if additionalValueType is a CompositeType)

getConditions.name: getConditions
getConditions.description: Function to get the existing conditions of the field.

asyncParsing.name: asyncParsing
asyncParsing.description: Callback function to tell the Field the parsing is asynchronous.

navigateCondition.name: navigateCondition
navigateCondition.description: Condition of keyboard navigation. If this is filled, no real parsing is needed as the condition has already been determined and is just returned

delegate.name: delegate
delegate.description: Field delegate to handle model-specific logic

preventGetDescription.name: preventGetDescription
preventGetDescription.description: If set, description is not read by formatValue as it is known that no description exists or might be set later

convertWhitespaces.name: convertWhitespaces
convertWhitespaces.description: If set, whitespaces will be replaced by special characters to display whitespaces in HTML

noFormatting.name: noFormatting
noFormatting.description: If set, the conditions will not be formatted (MultiInput value property case)

keepValue.name: keepValue
keepValue.description: If noFormatting is set, this value is used as output to keep the typed value during value help selection

multipleLines.name: multipleLines
multipleLines.description: If set, the input and output might contain multiple lines

emptyAllowed.name: emptyAllowed
emptyAllowed.description: If true, the connected control could be left empty (without conditions)

parameters.description: Formatting options

parameters.name: oConstraints
parameters.description: Value constraints

returnValue.description: The array of conditions or a Promise resolving with the array of conditions. If there is no value, null is returned.

parameters.description: The value that is parsed

parameters.name: sSourceType
parameters.description: The type of the given value; see {@link topic:ac56d92162ed47ff858fdf1ce26c18c4 Allowed Property Types} In addition to the standard source types, sap.ui.mdc.raw can be used. In this case the value is not parsed and just used in the condition. If the value of the condition is an array representing data for a CompositeType, the index of the needed raw value can be added to the name (For example, if a unit should be forwarded as raw value sap.ui.mdc.raw:1 can be used).

parameters.description: Index where new conditions should be inserted, if -1 they will just be added

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.content.ContentFactory
symbols.description: Object-based factory that handles the content creation process of the {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase}. Accepts an object literal mSettings that defines initial property values, aggregated and associated objects as well as event handlers. See {@link sap.ui.base.ManagedObject#constructor} for a general description of the syntax of the settings object. This class does not have its own settings, but all settings applicable to the base type {@link sap.ui.base.Object#constructor sap.ui.base.Object} can be used.

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.DynamicDateRangeConditionsType
symbols.description: This class represents a type to map an array of conditions used in a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control to a value of a {@link sap.m.DynamicDateRange DynamicDateRange} control.

parameters.name: oFormatOptions

valueType.name: valueType
valueType.description: Type of the value of the condition (used for formatting, parsing and validating)

additionalValueType.name: additionalValueType
additionalValueType.description: Type of the additionalValue (description) of the condition (used for formatting, parsing, and validating)

operators.name: operators
operators.description: Possible operators to be used in the condition

display.name: display
display.description: DisplayFormat used to visualize a value

valueHelpID.name: valueHelpID
valueHelpID.description: ID of the value help to determine the key and description

hideOperator.name: hideOperator
hideOperator.description: If set, only the value of the condition is shown, but no operator. (Use it only if just one operator is supported.)

bindingContext.name: bindingContext
bindingContext.description: BindingContext of field. Used to get a key or description from the value help using in/out parameters. (In a table, the value help might be connected to a different row)

originalDateType.name: originalDateType
originalDateType.description: Type used on field, for example, for date types; a different type is used internally to have different formatOptions

additionalType.name: additionalType
additionalType.description: Additional type used for another part of a field (for example, for unit fields)

compositeTypes.name: compositeTypes
compositeTypes.description: Additional types used for each part of a CompositeType (if valueType is a CompositeType)

additionalCompositeTypes.name: additionalCompositeTypes
additionalCompositeTypes.description: Additional types used for each part of a CompositeType (if additionalValueType is a CompositeType)

getConditions.name: getConditions
getConditions.description: Function to get the existing conditions of the field.

asyncParsing.name: asyncParsing
asyncParsing.description: Callback function to tell the Field the parsing is asynchronous.

navigateCondition.name: navigateCondition
navigateCondition.description: Condition of keyboard navigation. If this is filled, no real parsing is needed as the condition has already been determined and is just returned

delegate.name: delegate
delegate.description: Field delegate to handle model-specific logic

preventGetDescription.name: preventGetDescription
preventGetDescription.description: If set, description is not read by formatValue as it is known that no description exists or might be set later

convertWhitespaces.name: convertWhitespaces
convertWhitespaces.description: If set, whitespaces will be replaced by special characters to display whitespaces in HTML

noFormatting.name: noFormatting
noFormatting.description: If set, the conditions will not be formatted (MultiInput value property case)

keepValue.name: keepValue
keepValue.description: If noFormatting is set, this value is used as output to keep the typed value during value help selection

multipleLines.name: multipleLines
multipleLines.description: If set, the input and output might contain multiple lines

emptyAllowed.name: emptyAllowed
emptyAllowed.description: If true, the connected control could be left empty (without conditions)

symbols.name: sap.ui.mdc.field.FieldBase
symbols.description: The FieldBase control is the base class for the {@link sap.ui.mdc.Field Field}, {@link sap.ui.mdc.MultiValueField MultiValueField}, and {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls. It must not be used stand-alone.

properties.name: dataType
properties.description: The type of data handled by the field. This type is used to parse, format, and validate the value. Note: The module of the data type should be loaded before it is assigned to the field. Otherwise the asynchronous loading of the module might lead to unwanted side effects.

properties.name: dataTypeConstraints
properties.description: The constraints of the type specified in dataType.

properties.name: dataTypeFormatOptions
properties.description: The format options of the type specified in dataType.

properties.name: editMode
properties.description: Determines whether the field is editable, read-only, or disabled.

properties.name: required
properties.description: Indicates that user input is required.

properties.name: display
properties.description: Defines whether the value and/or description of the field is shown and in which order.

properties.name: textAlign
properties.description: Defines the horizontal alignment of the text that is shown inside the input field. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

properties.name: textDirection
properties.description: Defines the text directionality of the input field, for example, RTL or LTR. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

properties.name: placeholder
properties.description: Defines a short hint intended to help the user with the data entry when the control has no value. If the value is null, no placeholder is shown. Note: If the rendered control doesn't support this feature, this property is ignored.

properties.name: valueState
properties.description: Visualizes the validation state of the control, for example, Error, Warning or Success. Note: The visualization of the ValueState property is handled by the inner rendered control. If a control is set (using content, contentEdit, or contentDisplay), this control needs to support the valueState behavior, otherwise valueState is not visualized.

properties.name: valueStateText
properties.description: Defines the text that appears in the value state message pop-up. If this has not been specified, a default text from the resource bundle is shown.

properties.name: width
properties.description: Defines the width of the control.

properties.name: multipleLines
properties.description: If set, the Field is rendered using a multi-line control. This property only affects types that support multiple lines. This property is only used for single-value fields. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple lines, an error is thrown.

properties.name: maxConditions
properties.description: Sets the maximum number of conditions that are allowed for this field. The default value of -1 indicates that an unlimited number of conditions can be defined. Note If the data type used doesn't support multiple conditions, an error is thrown.

properties.name: conditions
properties.description:
Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. These should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} using the corresponding propertyPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property is used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to its parent {@link @link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar}.
If this property is not explicitly configured, the {@link @link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} sets a default binding. For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}.

properties.name: label
properties.description:
Defines the label text for the field.

This can be used by {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} or {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} controls to create a {@link sap.m.Label Label} control for the field.

properties.name: delegate
showEmptyIndicator
properties.description: If set, an empty Field renders an empty indicator in display mode. This property only takes effect if editMode is set to Display. Note Empty means the Field holds no value. If an empty string is a valid value, the Field might show nothing, depending on the display settings and assigned description or ValueHelp.

properties.name: _valueHelpEnabled
properties.description: Internal property to bind the showValueHelp property of the internal Input control.

properties.name: _ariaAttributes
properties.description: Sets the ARIA attributes added to the inner control. The object contains ARIA attributes in an aria node. Additional attributes, such as role, autocomplete or valueHelpEnabled, are added on root level.

properties.name: _operators
properties.description: Internal property to bind the operators to the internal DynamicDateRange (or other) control.

aggregations.name: content
aggregations.description: Optional content that can be rendered. Per default, depending on editMode, multipleLines and the used data type, a content control is rendered. For simple string types, a {@link sap.m.Text Text} control is rendered in display mode and a {@link sap.m.Input Input} control in edit mode. If a control is assigned in the content aggregation, this will be rendered instead. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

aggregations.name: contentEdit
aggregations.description: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Per default, depending on multipleLines and the used data type, a content control is rendered in edit mode. For simple string types, an {@link sap.m.Input Input} control is rendered in edit mode. If a control is assigned in the contentEdit aggregation, this will be rendered instead. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

aggregations.name: contentDisplay
aggregations.description: Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is set to Display. Per default, depending on multipleLines and the used data type, a content control is rendered in display mode. For simple string types, a {@link sap.m.Text Text} control is rendered in display mode. If a control is assigned in the contentDisplay aggregation, this will be rendered instead. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

aggregations.name: _content
aggregations.description: Internal content if no control set from outside.

aggregations.name: fieldInfo
aggregations.description: Optional FieldInfo used for detail information. This is only active in display mode. Especially {@link sap.ui.mdc.Link} can be used to activate link features. Note: If a special data type is defined or a content control is set, this is ignored.

associations.name: fieldHelp
associations.description: Optional FieldHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one ValueHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the ValueHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do, every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the ValueHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The FieldHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no ValueHelp should be added, but a default ValueHelp used instead.

associations.name: valueHelp
associations.description: Optional ValueHelp. This is an association that allows the usage of one ValueHelp instance for multiple fields. Note: If the field is inside of a table, do not set the ValueHelp instance as dependent to the field. If you do, every field instance in every table row gets a clone of it. Put the ValueHelp instance e.g. as dependent on the table or page. The ValueHelp instance must be somewhere in the control tree, otherwise there might be rendering or update issues. Note: For Boolean fields, no ValueHelp should be added, but a default ValueHelp used instead.

associations.name: ariaLabelledBy
associations.description: Association to controls / IDs that label this control (see WAI-ARIA attribute aria-labelledby).

events.name: liveChange
events.description: This event is fired when the value of the field is changed, for example, each time a key is pressed. Note This event is only triggered if the used content control has a liveChange event.

value.description: The new value of the input

escPressed.name: escPressed

events.name: submit
events.description: This event is fired when the user presses Enter. It allows the application to implement some submit logic. Note This event is only triggered if the field is editable.

promise.name: promise
promise.description: Returns a Promise for the change. The Promise returns the value if it is resolved. If the last change event is synchronous, the Promise has already been resolved. If it is asynchronous, it will be resolved after the value has been updated.

If no binding for the corresponding property exists null must be returned, as the event must only be fired if there is a binding.

methods.name: getConditions

returnValue.description: Value of property conditions

methods.description:
Gets current value of property {@link #getConditions conditions}. Sets the conditions that represent the values of the field. These should be bound to a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} using the corresponding propertyPath. Note: For {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} controls, the conditions property is used to bind {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} to its parent {@link @link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar}.
If this property is not explicitly configured, the {@link @link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} sets a default binding. For example, for a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterField FilterField} control inside a {@link sap.ui.mdc.FilterBar FilterBar} control, the binding looks like this:
conditions="{$filters>/conditions/propertyPath}" with the following data:
  • $filters as the name of the condition model
  • /conditions/ as a required static part of the binding
  • propertyPath as the property name
Note: A condition must have the structure of {@link sap.ui.mdc.condition.ConditionObject ConditionObject}. Default value is [].

methods.name: getContent
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContent content}. Optional content that can be rendered. Per default, depending on editMode, multipleLines and the used data type, a content control is rendered. For simple string types, a {@link sap.m.Text Text} control is rendered in display mode and a {@link sap.m.Input Input} control in edit mode. If a control is assigned in the content aggregation, this will be rendered instead. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

methods.name: getContentDisplay
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContentDisplay contentDisplay}. Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is set to Display. Per default, depending on multipleLines and the used data type, a content control is rendered in display mode. For simple string types, a {@link sap.m.Text Text} control is rendered in display mode. If a control is assigned in the contentDisplay aggregation, this will be rendered instead. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.

methods.name: getContentEdit
methods.description: Gets content of aggregation {@link #getContentEdit contentEdit}. Optional content to be rendered if the editMode property is not set to Display. Per default, depending on multipleLines and the used data type, a content control is rendered in edit mode. For simple string types, an {@link sap.m.Input Input} control is rendered in edit mode. If a control is assigned in the contentEdit aggregation, this will be rendered instead. Note: If a control is assigned to the content aggregation, this one is ignored. Note: Bind the value-holding property of the control to '$field>/conditions' using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionsType ConditionsType} as type. If the control needs to show multiple conditions, bind its aggregation to '$field>/conditions'. Bind the item controls value-holding property using {@link sap.ui.mdc.field.ConditionType ConditionType} as type. Warning: Only controls allowed in a {@link sap.ui.layout.form.Form Form} are allowed to be used for this optional content. Other controls might break the layout. This means the {@link sap.ui.core.IFormContent IFormContent} interface needs to be implemented by these controls.
